lexUnit.name: hiss.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a hissing sound (when human, made in disapproval)

sentence.text: The whistling of winds mingled with the hiss and rush of escaping air .
There was a series of low hisses and crackles , it was clearly not a professional recording , and she turned the volume up .
Luib and Isay were the first to dismount , and Riven heard the familiar hiss and crack of Myrcan staves .
Sharpe could hear the hiss and whiplash of musket bullets all around them .
Things go hiss and glug .
He opened his window and listened to the hiss and trickle of the fountain .
He listened to the hisses and pops of static as the number connected and the phone rang again .
Then there was a hiss and a door on the far side of the room slid open .
But tape ` hiss " remained a limiting factor , especially in stereo , and it was easy to hear the tape hiss start up on LP records .
They sat for a while in thoughtful silence while the shower passed from the surface of the lake and the light hiss of the rain ceased .
The rushing sound of the water finally subsided and was taken over by the hiss of the cistern refilling .
Later , Maud stood in there , turning her long body under the hot hiss of the shower .
Her whisper , all but drowned in the hiss of the flames , sounded fluttery and frail .
` We 'll be there in about thirty minutes , " the voice on the other end said , then there was a sharp hiss of static followed by silence .
And then we heard one final hiss of the safety valves and then silence .
Saturday night ; the pubs in the street would be doing good business but it was very quiet , only a faint hiss of escaping steam coming from the docks .
There was the rich stench of charred wood , and the python hiss of water on embers .
In one field he heard the hiss of scythes , and on a narrow terrace he saw two men weeding by lamplight .
The only sound was the rhythmical hiss of fluid escaping an opened artery .
The sibilant hiss of a sword being drawn sounded behind her and instantly the crowd dispersed , melting away into the shadowy alleys off the street .
There was no sound except for her breathing and the hiss of the air exchanger .
A sense of gloom blanketed his thought as he looked down to the dark water and heard the hiss of it rushing over the invisible weir ahead of him .
The intercom issued a tiny electronic hiss , but nothing more of Court 's voice .
Foam boiled up round the seal 's flank , then fell away with a soft , diminishing hiss .
She glimpsed a man busy at a cylinder , and again there was a hiss ! verifying that the cylinder was the source of the noise .
Record these background effects tapes at as high a level as possible to minimise tape hiss , and go for longish recording runs to give yourself plenty of margin at editing .
High overhead , its soft hiss merging unnoticed with the night breeze , an ultrasonic whistle triggered into life , beaming its urgent summons to the killer pack .
Only the hiss and wheeze of Tsu Tiao 's laboured breathing broke the awful silence .
Then , with a furious hiss as she saw my gaze drop and become a stare , she whirled to present me with her back .
The spit and hiss of a cornered cat may startle an attacker because of its suddenness and also because it is reminiscent of the threat display of a venomous snake .
The sharp hiss of an angry breath drawn through clenched teeth stopped him in his tracks .
His voice was soft as the hiss of a snake .
There 's a hiss of people talking and laughing , and the explosive shrieks of children playing , shaking off the intensity of the afternoon .
She heard the sharp hiss of his indrawn breath , and then he bent forwards and drew her gently up into his arms .
Rostov expelled breath in an involuntary hiss of awe .
His voice dropped to a low hiss .
I give a fearful deadly hiss .
Monica let out a cat-like hiss .
She drew in her breath in a sharp hiss .
